feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 3:31PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow On The Taylor Highway Above 3000 feet Tonight Through Wednesday Night... Snow is expect over summits of the Taylor Highway tonight through Wednesday night. The Taylor Highway Summits above 3000 feet could see 3 inches of snow from tonight through Wednesday night. Hunters and motorists venturing above 3000 feet should prepare
entry.cap:areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 3:31PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Significant Snowfall In Eastern Alaska Range Tonight Through Wednesday Night... Snow is falling in the Eastern Alaska Range above 2500 feet, with heavier snow above 3500 feet. The Richardson Highway from Black Rapids south could see 3 to 6 inches of snow through Wednesday night. Above 3500 feet, which is higher than the highway could see

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 8:39AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: Periods of moderate precipitation has caused rises to the Susitna River and tributary creeks and streams in the Susitna Valley, including Willow Creek. Smaller rivers may see water levels at bankfull, however, flooding is not expected. Rainfall will diminish later today.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 11:17PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Above 3000 Feet Late Tonight Into Tuesday... Snow is expected to develop late tonight above 3000 feet and continue into Tuesday. Up to 3 inches is possible in Atigun Pass. with lesser amounts just below pass level.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 12:55PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heat Index Values Between 95 and 100 this Afternoon... Unseasonably hot temperatures are expected through the afternoon today, ranging between 90 and 95 for most. These hot temperatures will combine with dew points between 65 and 70. Thus, yielding heat index values between 95 to around 100 through the afternoon. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 2:03PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty winds expected through Wednesday... A slow moving, strong low pressure system off of the Northern California Coast will bring gusty south winds to much of Nevada this afternoon with a frontal passage expected to repeat these winds Wednesday. South winds have already increase this afternoon reaching speeds of 25 to 30 mph and gusts around 30 to 40 mph.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 5:26AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of warm temperatures and high dewpoints will produce heat indices between 105 and 109 degrees today. Residents with outdoor activities planned are urged to drink plenty of water, wear light weight and light colored clothing and take frequent breaks from the heat. Young children and pets should never be left

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued September 20 at 3:00AM PDT until September 20 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty north winds and dry conditions Tuesday... .North winds will increase down the Okanogan Valley Tuesday. Strong winds will be coupled with dry conditions Tuesday afternoon into the early evening increasing the potential for rapid spread of any new fires. Winds will peak in the early afternoon and decrease early Tuesday evening.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 5:32PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Carbon and central Albany Counties through 615 PM MDT... At 529 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Hanna to 6 miles south of Medicine Bow to 10 miles southeast of Arlington. Movement was northeast at 25 mph.
